summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds were generally steady and moderate (mean ≈ 5.7 m/s, sd ≈ 0.67) with stable rotor speed (rotor rpm sd ≈ 0.53) and modest pitch activity (mean ≈ -1.45°), though there was a short high‑wind spike up to 25.8 m/s and unusually high generator rpm variability (std ≈ 59.7). Power was low on average (mean ≈ 0.159) and tended to run below expectations (mean residual ≈ -0.077), while a persistent yaw misalignment (~12.6°) and an elevated mean temperature (~50°C) are notable despite no non‑normal status indications.
